bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law. Enrollment Management is the administrative area of the University that includes the Offices of University Admission, Financial Assistance and Registrar.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Admissions department, the Registrar, and the Part Time Studies program. Admissions department files include a list of students and teachers (1843-1895); lists of students (1895-1896 and 1902-1912); student grades (1882-1895); freshman bulletins (1971-1987); annual reports of the Admissions department from the 1990s; and a manual of procedures for the department. Registrar's files include registration forms; class schedules (1800s, 1920); examination schedules (1950-1954); lists of religious affiliation of students (1962-1964); statistical reports on degrees awarded (1922-2007); enrollment reports; and annual reports of the Registrar (1937-1941). Records of the Part Time Studies program include course and exam schedules; policies and procedures; news clippings about the program; and reports of enrollment statistics. The collection also includes a nearly complete run of commencement programs (1850-2008) and commencement programs for Summer Sessions (1937-1962) and the Law School (1978-1995).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
